notes:
**[UPDATE FOR FREJA]**
Since Freja has a lot more damage build into her kit, to be able to sustain the damage, utilizing [Armored Vest](item_358361e2-59be-4c81-b221-8a87f37809e6) in Round 1 is fine over [First Aid Kit](item_0172eaaa-1902-44a3-b989-d12f0f7301da).

Round 1 is very basic, and pretty much all people utilize the same items and Power.

There's honestly not many other ways to do Round 1 for Mercy.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.

If there's a Reaper, I sometimes take Armoured Vest instead of First Aid Kit just to tank any flanks that happen in Round 1. Otherwise, this isn't worth getting over First Aid Kit, since Mercy regens faster than other supports, and having that proc 33% faster is better than armour.

notes:
In Round 2 you should have just enough cash to be able to buy [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca). If you have to sell *everything*, that's okay, this build is focusing on damage output of the overall team and enhancing the TTK (time-to-kill) of other players/abilities.

Typically, I sell all of my items and then re-buy [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) and  [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf) if I can. If I have extra cash, I buy [Heartbeat Sensor](item_2a4ffaf4-f14b-47d2-a267-0a0e83e87418).

If it's a really good round, I can sometimes speed-run [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e). This is a rare occurrence, but sometimes it happens on more close rounds.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.
You should no longer need this item because of the 50 armour provided by Chain Evoker.

The reason for picking up this item is the additional movement speed. Your focus early on is staying alive so that you can farm cash and movement speed helps with that a lot. The bonus of seeing low health enemies thru walls to help ping for your teams is an added perk.

notes:
Please read the Power's note for reasons on picking [Glass Extra Full](item_659ff350-8602-42cd-b5f9-f4da7e5e912b)!

Round 3 is where the build gets tricky. You're going to want to start stacking weapon power and attack speed at an even amount. The best combination I've found for Round 3 and Round 4 is in the build, but feel free to play around with other items that you feel work best.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.

Overhealth is one of the few types of health in Overwatch that isn't countered by a weapon type, so having this Power early on to help your teammates win duels is strong. Topping up allies while in spawn before the match starts gives your team an advantage, as well.
If you'd like a little more weapon power, feel free to keep this item.
Taking this item over Talon Modification Module helps with keeping the 1:1 ratio of weapon power / attack speed, while also giving you a 5% cooldown reduction on guardian angel.

notes:
Round 4 mirrors Round 3 in items, but feel free to add on stronger items if you can afford them, such as [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a) paired with [Aftermarket Firing Pin](item_2485b212-b286-42d0-a2bd-20eb4396b054).

If you find yourself struggling to stay alive, do not be fooled by the armour or shield options in survival - they don't help at all. Instead, pick an item like [Angeleisure Wear](item_00b53ed7-0768-442b-a2c3-8d19608c9391) or [Blessed Boosters](item_957fd380-b7b4-40d4-8333-bb8c535ca931)!
I personally opt for [Blessed Boosters](item_957fd380-b7b4-40d4-8333-bb8c535ca931), since the launch velocity helps with being slippery, staying in the rafters of a lot of maps, or easily getting into high ground that Mercy otherwise struggles with without close teammates.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.

Overhealth is one of the few types of health in Overwatch that isn't countered by a weapon type, so having this Power early on to help your teammates win duels is strong. Topping up allies while in spawn before the match starts gives your team an advantage, as well.
If you're on maps with a lot of free space to fly around (i.e. Dam), picking this item helps with mobility. It takes a few games to get used to, but it's very nice to have once you do.

notes:
Since you now have [Triage Unit](item_fec0554c-2685-4b93-822d-bf0020e654b4) in Round 5, you can lay off focusing the 1:1 ratio and focus on pivoting into the end-game build.

The end-game build is going to heavily focus on weapon power and survivability. In Round 5 and Round 6 we're going to gather the mobility items. Round 7 is going to go all-in on the weapon power.

[Blessed Boosters](item_957fd380-b7b4-40d4-8333-bb8c535ca931) is going to be the must pick here, if you can also get [Angelic Acrobatics](item_baad85fc-3da5-43af-ad9d-f17885f59aa5) without sacrificing your weapon power, do so.

Fill in your items with any weapon power and attack speed items you like to play with. I like to keep [Icy Coolant](item_8b1c21e9-33e8-49a6-8277-a3a06d55a65f) and [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e), while utilizing [Compensator](item_2a354f80-610c-4661-9bdd-8960ae1a60b0) and [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf) since they're still cheap.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.

Overhealth is one of the few types of health in Overwatch that isn't countered by a weapon type, so having this Power early on to help your teammates win duels is strong. Topping up allies while in spawn before the match starts gives your team an advantage, as well.
Mercy is typically flying around and helping allies where she can, so this Power in Round 5 is scaled to be impactful immediately depending upon your weapon power.
Only pick this if you have the money to while not sacrificing your weapon power.

notes:
In Round 6 you're going to pick up [Angelic Acrobatics](item_baad85fc-3da5-43af-ad9d-f17885f59aa5) to become the gnat that everyone fears Mercy being.

Swap out [Icy Coolant](item_8b1c21e9-33e8-49a6-8277-a3a06d55a65f) for [Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448), since it's going to give us more weapon power and more cooldown reduction.

[Hardlight Accelerator](item_0390c8af-2a68-4da2-b876-93da32c3f448) pairs with [Advanced Nanobiotics](item_26fcf7c9-b81a-4d8e-a459-b515519cb73e), so keep that, if you can. Tack on [Weapon Grease](item_961ae72f-434f-406b-a89b-ab8efec806bf) if you'd like the 1:1 ratio.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.

Overhealth is one of the few types of health in Overwatch that isn't countered by a weapon type, so having this Power early on to help your teammates win duels is strong. Topping up allies while in spawn before the match starts gives your team an advantage, as well.
Mercy is typically flying around and helping allies where she can, so this Power in Round 5 is scaled to be impactful immediately depending upon your weapon power.

notes:
By Round 7, you should be able to have this fully built out.

The end-game of this build is always to become the ultimate team-wide pocket so having [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb) level up Valkyrie to the next step is important. This is why [Chain Evoker](item_812cc89e-feb0-47d0-9e03-9d8e33a80aca) is mandatory in this build, and never sold.

[Eye of the Spider](item_bbaf01d7-340d-4199-b738-86a98d68fe9b) and [The Closer](item_173c6d0f-dbe6-440e-924f-0ce08189ddce) are going to be really good for when you go glocking during [Crepuscular Circle](item_c0b93ed2-b692-44d5-a38a-ce5a63e83cdb)'s activation, on top of them being high in weapon power!

If you can't afford one or the other, replace it with [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124).

If you are severely lagging behind in cash, and can't grab either of those 2, get [Amari's Antidote](item_67e0b1c5-3bcb-4ab5-b818-5082e5706124) and [Talon Modification Module](item_c0ca1795-a3ea-4dc9-ae17-f34122574b3a). More weapon power is the most important due to how scaled up everything is.

round_upgrades.notes: This item scales the best from Round 1 to 7, and has no range on the attached beam - that I can find - so it's best to get early and not have to worry about choosing later on.

Overhealth is one of the few types of health in Overwatch that isn't countered by a weapon type, so having this Power early on to help your teammates win duels is strong. Topping up allies while in spawn before the match starts gives your team an advantage, as well.
Mercy is typically flying around and helping allies where she can, so this Power in Round 5 is scaled to be impactful immediately depending upon your weapon power.
This Power allows for Valk to automatically target healing and damage amp every ally within view, so we don't have to bother with that or beam management! Glock away, besties.
